Definition.Description: Nov 1, 2018 12:00 AM - Dec 1, 2018 9:00 AM Power/Efficiency Analysis Assumption:  Viscosity correction is not considered  Just pump efficiency is considered (motor and drive efficiency is not considered) No logic is implemented for treating invalid/missing data Hydraulic Power Calculation: (Workstep) $HeadFT= DischargePress(psi)/0.433/Fluid SG $flowGPM = Total flow.convertUnits('gal/min')
Definition.Document:
Time range

Nov 1, 2018 12:00 AM - Dec 1, 2018 9:00 AM

Power/Efficiency Analysis

Assumption: 

  • Viscosity correction is not considered 
  • Just pump efficiency is considered (motor and drive efficiency is not considered)
  • No logic is implemented for treating invalid/missing data

Hydraulic Power Calculation: (Workstep)

$HeadFT= DischargePress(psi)/0.433/Fluid SG $flowGPM = Total flow.convertUnits('gal/min')   (($HeadFT*$flowGPM*$d)/3956).setUnits('hp')

Pump Efficiency from the pump curve:(Workstep)

((-0.0005527414344*$flow.convertUnits('gal/min')*$flow.convertUnits('gal/min')).setUnits('')+(0.3573436103*$flow.convertUnits('gal/min')).setUnits('')+4.765138665)  .setUnits('%')

Break HP Calculation:(Workstep)

Hydraulic HP/Pump Efficiency

Cost of pumping Calculation:(Workstep)

Specific energy (Es) is good measure to use for calculating the cost of pumping. This is the energy used to move a certain volume through the system. It is measured as Watt hours/gallon, or any other suitable units, and it has the advantage of being a direct measurement of the cost of pumping once you know the cost of energy. (This is the same as measuring the miles per gallon for a car.) 

$HeadFT= DischargePress(psi)/0.433/Fluid SG  $flowGPM = Total flow.convertUnits('gal/min')  (($HeadFT*$FluidSG*0.75)/efficiency).setUnits('')

Reference
